args:
After Valfarre is revived by a mysterious power,
the legendary Xu Fu appears and tells the group
that pyroblossoms are the key to defeating it.
With those words ringing in their ears, the
prince and his party once again mount an
assault on the space between worlds.
No! The passage to the Otherworld\nhas reopened!
How can such a thing be happening\nwhen we already defeated Valfarre?!
Peng Lai is ever an able protector.\nLook there! The passageway closes!
'Fraid that's just a temporary measure,\nyoung'uns. It'll rip itself open again soon.
Just like I feared, Valfarre went and got\nitself resurrected stronger than ever!
That Valfarre only cares about one thing:\ngobblin' up as much mana as it can.
So long as it's doin' that, there ain't no\nway to defeat it.

Even worse, it looks like it found a way
to start eatin' that black mana too,
which means it's got an inexhaustible
supply of the stuff now.
I got no idea how we're gonna take out\na critter what basically has eternal life.
It is chilling to hear such words from you,\nPeng Lai. What are we to do?
For now, I'm hopin' you'll grant a selfish\nrequest from an old fart of a dragon...
Help m'children in Peng Lai.\nTake 'em and get 'em to safety.
A town don't mean squat without the\nfolks inside it! Save 'em and worry about\nbuildin' a new town once this is over.
I can't believe I'm hearing this...
Peng Lai is no mere town! It is my home!
It is my home now as it has ever been,\nand I would give anything to save it.
Peng Lai, I once defied my father and\nattempted to spread my pyroblossoms\nacross the land.
But no matter how hard I tried,\nthey would not accept them.

They said they were a bother. A nuisance.
And when I returned home with my tail
between my legs, all that awaited me
was the news of my parents' passing.
My dreams were gone. My family was\ngone. And yet Peng Lai—my home—\nwas ever there for me.
The streets and shops were the same...\nMy grandparents' love was the same...

And even though I had lost everything,
this taught me something: There is a
kind of brilliance in having a home that
never changes.
Please, Peng Lai. I need THAT town.\nNot a rebuilt version of it.
Such is my wish as well!
C'mon, Gramps! Let's think of something!
Heck, I don't wanna see the town go\nneither! But there just ain't no way we\ncan defeat Valfarre like it is now.
Such capitulation ill befits you, Peng Lai.
The man who founded Peng Lai?\nThe one from the legendary Qilin tribe?

It has been a long time, children of
Peng Lai. And what's more, it seems the
one who has answered my call is a
successor to the blood of dragons.
Wait. That voice... It's you!\nYOU'RE who I heard in my dream!
And I thank you for answering my call.\nWere you not here, opposing Valfarre\nwould likely prove quite difficult.
You speak as though you have an idea\nof how to combat this evil.
Indeed I do. In fact, I have been preparing\nfor this moment for over a hundred years.
It's why I gave the craft of pyroblossoms\nto the town of Peng Lai.
And what use could mere amusements\nbe against such a wicked being?
The secret is not in the pyroblossoms,\nbut in the technicians who create them.
When creating pyroblossoms, technicians\ncapture mana from the dragon-vein spring\nand precisely redirect it to their fireworks.

That same technique can be used to
remove the mana surrounding Valfarre,
which will make it possible to slay
the fiend once and for all.
I attempted to do so a century ago,\nbut my power was not sufficient.

Thus did I spread the knowledge of
pyroblossoms around the town,
that I might find someone whose
strength would aid my own.
I cannot believe this secret was hidden\nwith the pyroblossom technicians.
Yes, Su Fang. With you here,\nwe can defeat Valfarre for good.
But in order to accomplish that, we also\nneed warriors with the might to chip away\nat the fiend's seemingly limitless power.
Which is why you summoned His Highness.
Indeed. Forgive me for the rather\nundignified summons, but I could not\nrisk moving too far from Valfarre.
Think nothing of it. I'm happy to help.
Valfarre approaches, as does our time.\nCan I rely on you all?
Yes. We'll travel to the space between\nworlds and weaken Valfarre there.
I ain't good at much, but I'm REAL good\nat poundin' evil. Lemme at it already!
